intro: Lotononis maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in Mediterranean climates.
